sentences: UNB (Hangul: 유앤비) was a South Korean boy group formed through the KBS reality show The Unit.
section: N/A

sentences: The group was composed of nine members: Jun, Euijin, Ko Ho-jung, Feeldog, Marco, Ji Han-sol, Daewon, Kijung, and Chan.
section: N/A

sentences: Their debut album, Boyhood, was released on April 7, 2018.
section: N/A

sentences: UNB ended their activities on January 27, 2019.
section: N/A
== History ==

sentences: History ==
section: == History ==
== History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project =
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===
== History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Prior to The Unit, all the members were actively involved in the entertainment industry: Feeldog debuted in 2012 as a member of Big Star.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Euijin joined A.cian in 2014 under the name Lo-J but left the group in 2015 due to problems with the company, later debuting again in 2016 as a member of Bigflo.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Daewon debuted as a member of Madtown in 2014 which later disbanded during the show.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Ko Hojung debuted as a member of Hotshot in 2014.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Jun joined U-KISS as the youngest member in 2014.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: In 2017, Chan debuted as a member of A.C.E, Kijung as a member of IM, and Marco as a member of Hot Blood Youth.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: Ji Hansol is a former SM Rookies trainee who left the company in 2017 to sign with J-FLO Entertainment and debuted with Newkidd.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: In July 2017, KBS announced their new survival show that would create male and female unit groups, with nine members each, among idols who had already debuted.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: The program aimed to give them a fair chance to demonstrate their talents that they might not have been able to showcase before.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: It premiered on October 28, 2017 and concluded on February 10, 2018.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: In November 2017, it was announced that the winning group will do promotions for seven months
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: and if the winning group gained success, their contract will be extended up to twenty-five months.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: The winning group members had opportunity to participate in other activities with their original agencies.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: On February 21, 2018, it was revealed that the male group, Uni+ B, would hold their first fan-meeting on March 3 at Blue Square iMarket Hall.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: The tickets sold out within two hours of being on sale.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===

sentences: On February 24's broadcast of The Unit's Special Show, the final nine male contestants that formed "Uni+ B" became UNB following the announcement.
section: == History == | === The Unit: Idol Rebooting Project ===
== History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: On April 7, UNB officially made their debut with their extended play titled Boyhood.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: The EP featured double title tracks, "Feeling" and "Only One".
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: They held their debut stage on You Hee-yeol's Sketchbook.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: On June 1, a dance battle video was released, showcasing the chorus of the new song, Black Heart.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Over the following days, other clips teasing the song were released as well.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: On June 11, a mysterious poster was posted online.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: The poster showed eye close-ups of two men and women, along with the date 28 June 2018 and UNB's logo.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: It was later revealed to be the release date of the group's second mini-album.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Later, on June 18, conceptual photos were released, which revealed the identities of the faces in the poster:
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Jungha (formerly of Beatwin; ranked 30th)
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Hangyul (BAE173; ranked 13th)
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Jueun (DIA)
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: Anne (S.I.S; ranked 22nd)All except for Jueun had participated on The Unit alongside UNB.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: The photoset's title included the term "Performance feat.", indicating their participation in the album's upcoming promotion cycle.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===

sentences: On June 28, the EP Black Heart was released, along with the music video of the lead track with the same name.
section: == History == | === 2018–2019: Debut, Boyhood, Black Heart and UNB Disbandment ===
